html:
The president of the Actors Guild of Nigeria has called for mass prayers and increased unionisation after the death of two actors in Owerri, the capital city of Imo State.

Posting on Instagram, Emeka Rollas advocated spiritual intervention and better workplace regulation to try to prevent future tragedies after the two men, who have not yet been named, died on Friday.

â€œSo sad some Actors who are not members of the Actors Guild lost their lives while filming,â€ ran the message on his main post. â€œWe have repeatedly warned that actors must join the guild to practice in Nollywood.â€

In a caption alongside, Rollas reflected that the deaths had occurred â€œbarely a week after the [1 year] memorial serviceâ€ of Junior Pope, one of the countryâ€™s most influential actors and producers.

Pope, 39, died on 10 April 2024 alongside three crew members in a boat accident on the River Niger, while travelling to Asaba to shoot a new film.

Rollas concluded from the apparently unrelated events that â€œthe devil still wants this pattern of mass death repeated on an annual basisâ€.

Details of the deaths last weekend remain unclear but reports suggest the two actors died at a house party given by a director, which left two others hospitalised. The director and three other people present were later arrested.

A spokesperson for the Imo State Police Command, Henry Okoye, confirmed the incident and said an investigation into the cause of the deaths had begun. â€œThe command is aware of the unfortunate incident of unnatural death,â€ he said. â€œI can confirm that two people were pronounced dead while two were hospitalised.â€

In his Instagram post, Rollas credited God with the death toll in Owerri not being four â€“ the same number, he said, as â€œlast year in Asabaâ€.

He continued by saying that he had organised a prayer programme before concluding with a caution to those who might sign up to work on productions without union representation.

â€œThis is a bad trend. These people camp themselves in an unhealthy, unverified environment making content,â€ wrote Rollas. â€œContent creators have to be licensed.
